alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe; Surry; Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 7:59AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...An area of heavy rain will impact portions of Alleghany, northwestern Surry, north central Watauga and Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina, Smyth, southeastern Bland, Wythe, southwestern Carroll and Grayson Counties in southwestern Virginia and the City of Galax through 830 AM EDT... At 758 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of heavy rain over Mount Rogers Summit, or near Whitetop, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wytheville... Galax... Marion... Chilhowie... Sparta... Jefferson... and Rural Retreat. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
